thread.title: Stranded! No tourists allowed to leave or arrive into Bali, Indonesia
thread.title_full: Stranded! No tourists allowed to leave or arrive into Bali, Indonesia

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Stranded! No tourists allowed to leave or arrive into Bali, Indonesia
text:
The Islands of Bali and Lombok are closed: No visitors able to leave or arrive by air Stranded! No tourists allowed to leave or arrive into Bali, Indonesia Adv: 
Jul 10, 2015 Adv: 
Are you planning to fly to Den Pasar Bali, to Lombok, Jember or Banyuwangi today or in the near future? You may be out of luck. Vacationing in Bali and ready to go home - maybe not. 
No one, including tourists, are allowed to leave the Indonesian Islands of the Gods right now by air. 
Indonesian authorities shut four airports on Friday, including on the popular holiday destination island of Bali, due to a volcanic eruption, flag carrier Garuda Indonesia said on its official Twitter account. 
The airport codes closed are DPS, LOP, JBB and BWX. 
Mount Raung in East Java has been erupting for nearly a week. The Indonesian transport ministry official JA Barata said the re-opening of the airports would be based on Mount Raung's activity. Some reports say, airports may re-open as early as 21.30 local time tonight.
